programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2004, Rebecca Barney and her soon-to-be ex-husband Fred were found shot to death in their Tulsa, Oklahoma, home, which had been set on fire.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman who was known to have suffered from depression apparently took her own life. But her sister told police that, a year before her death, she said if anything were to happen to her, there was a note in the china cabinet.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2006, Nevada politician Kathy Augustine died mysteriously during a hard-fought re-election campaign and the medical examiner could neither isolate the cause of death, nor explain the tiny puncture wounds discovered during the autopsy.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, Grand Junction, Colorado is on edge after a series of deadly bombings which has killed 2 and injured one more. Police race to find the culprit before he strikes again.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: This episode documents a deadly bombing at a church in Oakwood, Illinois, in December 1997.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman is found dead in her apartment. With little evidence at the scene, the case turns cold... until police discover a link between their prime suspect and an unsolved murder committed six years earlier in a different state.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2000,¾Kristine Fitzhugh¾failed to show up for her music class and her husband Ken found her dead at the bottom of the stairs of their Palo Alto home. Upon further investigation, luminol reveals evidence of murder in the kitchen.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Security cameras in a casino tracked a young woman's movements until shortly before she disappeared. She was never seen again, but through the evidence she left behind, she was able to tell investigators what happened to her and who was responsible.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A college senior was found raped and murdered near an unpaved footpath used by students to walk from one side of campus to the other.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was one of the most unusual cases in forensic history. Investigators had to find a way to solve a murder case with evidence which consisted of a squashed tomato found at the crime scene, and tiny, pinpoint reflections of light in a photograph.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A millionaire and his family were executed in their own home. For three years, the murders went unsolved and then a 30-year-old box of ammunition and some fluorescent fibers revealed the ultimate betrayal.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, Dorothy Donovan was murdered in her Dover, Delaware home and police are skeptical when her son Charles Holden stated that she was murdered by a hitchhiker he had picked up.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young fireman died from what appeared to be serious but undiagnosed heart disease, his family and friends were devastated but they had no proof of foul play.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 13-year-old girl went missing from her Colorado home, and the only evidence¾the kidnapper¾left behind was three fingerprints on a window screen.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Rachael Mullenix, 19, was convicted of stabbing her mother, Barbara Mullenix, on Sept. 13, 2006, and then packing her bloodied corpse in a cardboard box before dumping it in Newport Bay on the California coast.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A successful stockbroker told his wife he'd be working late, and when he didn't come home, she reported him missing.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, Virginia Beach police arrive at the Makdessi apartment to find Elise Makdessi and her lover Quincy Brown dead.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1995, Palm Beach waitress Denise O'Neill is abducted and murdered. Her neighbor Luis Caballero arouses suspicions by his odd behavior toward TV crews covering the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In the early hours of a morning just before Christmas, a college co-ed was abducted from the parking lot of her apartment. Her body was found later that day; she'd been sexually assaulted and then shot at point blank range.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A serial killer was on the loose and police had to find him before he struck again. Their most promising lead was an unusual one: a bloody fingerprint on the body of one of the victims.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Seattle police had no suspects in the violent murder of post-grunge singer, Mia Zapata. More than a decade passed before the evidence collected by a prescient medical examiner could be used by forensic scientists to identify the killer.

programme.title: Containment
programme.desc: With the cordon now under the control of the National Guard, Lex finds himself clashing with the Captain in charge of the operation. Inside, Jana fends off a violent attack.

programme.title: Containment
programme.desc: While Dr. Cannerts makes a major breakthough in finding a cure for the virus, Jana and Suzy make a plan to break free of the cordon using underground tunnels.

programme.title: Containment
programme.desc: Trapped in isolation and cut off from their chain of command, Lex and Dr. Lommers can only stand by helplessly as the cordon erupts into mass chaos.

programme.title: Containment
programme.desc: While Teresa goes into labor, Lex grows concerned about Dr. Lommers' behavior and Leo continues to unravel the conspiracy behind the outbreak.

programme.title: Containment
programme.desc: Lex and Leo clash over their next move after a failed plan threatens to unravel their entire case. And an unexpected turn of events brings Jake and Katie closer together.

programme.title: Containment
programme.desc: As Jana, Sam and Suzy pull together the funds they need to plot their escape, Jake considers his own options for breaking out of the cordon.

programme.title: Containment
programme.desc: In the series finale, Jana, Teresa and others make their dangerous escape out of the cordon, while Lex makes a decision that will change his life forever.

programme.title: Eleventh Hour
programme.desc: When evidence suggests that someone is attempting human cloning, Dr. Jacob Hood, Special Science Advisor to the FBI, is called in to investigate.

programme.title: Eleventh Hour
programme.desc: When several healthy 11-year-old boys in Georgia die of heart attacks, Dr. Jacob Hood is called upon to determine the cause and prevent further deaths.

programme.title: Eleventh Hour
programme.desc: When multiple cases of food contamination that result in life-threatening paralysis are reported in Northern California, Dr. Jacob Hood is called upon to investigate.

programme.title: Eleventh Hour
programme.desc: Dr. Jacob Hood must figure out why severely autistic teenagers are disappearing across the country - only to reappear a month later exhibiting symptoms of savant syndrome.

programme.title: Eleventh Hour
programme.desc: When an aggressive and deadly virus infects a demolition site in Pittsburgh, Dr. Hood is called in to contain a potentially lethal outbreak.

programme.title: Eleventh Hour
programme.desc: When a woman's body is discovered on the beach on the hottest day of the year -- frozen solid with no signs of thawing -- Dr. Jacob Hood is called in to investigate.

programme.title: Eleventh Hour
programme.desc: When one of the government's experiments to enhance the abilities of its soldiers goes lethally off track, Dr. Jacob Hood is called upon to investigate what went wrong.

programme.title: Eleventh Hour
programme.desc: When college students in landlocked Oklahoma begin dying of the bends, Dr. Jacob Hood's investigation uncovers an elaborate medical cover-up on campus.

programme.title: Eleventh Hour
programme.desc: When Spring Break revelers are mysteriously exposed to a deadly flesh-eating bacteria, Dr. Jacob Hood must find the cause...and the cure.

programme.title: Eleventh Hour
programme.desc: Hood succumbs to a mysterious outbreak of violent behavior.

programme.title: Eleventh Hour
programme.desc: Dr. Jacob Hood rushes to debunk what he believes to be a fraudulent miracle cure being broadcast on national news.

programme.title: Eleventh Hour
programme.desc: An autopsy on a millionaire reveals signs of congenital heart disease - and two fully developed hearts - leading the FBI to send Dr. Jacob Hood to investigate.

programme.title: Eleventh Hour
programme.desc: A string of stem cell thefts, indicating an elaborate cloning operation, leads Dr. Hood to suspect that his old nemesis, Gepetto (guest star KATE BURTON), has returned.

programme.title: Eleventh Hour
programme.desc: When a healthy helicopter pilot is struck blind in the midst of his live TV traffic report - resulting in a very public and tragic crash - Hood is sent in to investigate.

programme.title: Eleventh Hour
programme.desc: When thirty people are struck dead by lightning during a single ten-minute thunderstorm, Dr. Hood knows bad luck has nothing to do with it.

programme.title: Eleventh Hour
programme.desc: Dr. Hood is brought in to investigate a poison cluster when seemingly unrelated people from around the city simultaneously fall prey to the same symptoms of toxic exposure.

programme.title: Eleventh Hour
programme.desc: Fashion Week in New York City turns deadly when sudden outbursts of rage by people with no prior history of violence result in four homicides in less than 24 hours.

programme.title: Eleventh Hour
programme.desc: A woman accuses the Deputy Director of the FBI of stealing her baby and keeping her forcibly medicated as part of a cover up, and Dr. Hood believes she could be telling the truth.

programme.title: The Freedom Center
programme.desc: Across centuries of struggle, freedom has carried many meanings, some painful, some powerful. This documentary pulls back the curtain on forgotten stories and surprising truths, leaving one question: what does freedom really look like today, and what might it become tomorrow?

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: We explore how entrepreneurs reduce waste, enhance recycling and transform reused materials into unique goods. These efforts craft a sustainable tomorrow.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Hit the books, explore underground, and find out why local bites and beds make the Happy Valley so Happy in this legendary college town.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: ‘Fight for your right’ to start the day right with a ‘90s-themed breakfast. Climb aboard a bicycle built for twelve, and cruise between boozy destinations that feature everything from classy cocktails to intoxicating IV bags.

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.desc: Angel gets her sea legs with Maritime mogul, Captain Bobby LaPin. They sail Baltimore's iconic harbor, dive deep into the city's green initiatives, shuck oysters, and head out crabbing with the best seafarers Charm City has to offer.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: The brutal murders of two trans women of color just 48 hours apart in New Orleans unsettle the community, leaving many wondering if the cases are connected. Detectives uncover clues, yet justice remains elusive.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Justin and Ryan surprise a little boy awaiting a heart transplant with a fun-filled afternoon at Boston Chidlren's Hospital. From video games and candy, to a hot sauce challenge, the team will put a smile on everyone's face.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Cyber-burglars, a dangerous mix of con artist and geek, wreak havoc on the technologically vulnerable. Our experts offer tips to spot such high-tech trickery before it's too late.

programme.title: KCCI Local News
programme.desc: Get the latest news and weather from KCCI.

programme.title: Underdog Uprising
programme.desc: Every game day, fans pour into the stands to cheer on New Mexico's soccer team. But these are no ordinary supporters. From the Curse, to Sektor 114, to the Black Diamonds these fans are making New Mexico United.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Let's "MEAT" today's chefs: BBQ Boss Chef Sam is looking to roast her competitor, Rotisserie Chef Joseph Burton, in today's game-day feast challenge. Which of these meat maestros will craft the ultimate game day spread?

programme.title: KCCI Close Up
programme.desc: Changing how area education agencies work with schools across the state; the house proposal that passed this weekand the fiery fight over funding.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Jessie Fiacco is a single mother and nurse, who during the pandemic made home visits. But Jessie hasn’t made time for herself. Luckily for her, Kinga is in town to show Jessie she doesn’t have to travel far to get far out.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: In this battle, it's sink or swim. Chef Josiah of Purple Ocean Superfood Bar in Waterford Lakes takes on Chef Daniel of The Moderne in the Mills 50 district. We’ve got a seafood extravaganza on this episode of Blind Kitchen.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Two serial killers whose chilling crimes left their communities devastated.

programme.title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.desc: A police investigation into a missing seven-year-old girl in Manchester, New Hampshire reveals harrowing details that shock the state. But even more disturbing is the discovery that the tragic outcome could have been avoided.

programme.title: Mo Gaba: Spirit Lives Forever
programme.desc: How a child living with cancer changed the Baltimore sports community forever.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: The Golden State Killer, also known as the East Area Rapist, remained a mystery for years.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Maverick Meyers is a shy 17 year old gamer who spends 8 hours a day on his self-built computer. Kinga meets Maverick in Clermont, Florida to take him out of his comfort zone on an outing he’ll never forget.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: Kate regains her faith in the classic Hurricane, talks history and equity in the cocktail industry, pledges allegiance to the French 75, and dives into a rich New Orleans cocktail culture that’s much bigger than Bourbon Street.

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: In Kansas City, you can’t say tattoos without saying the name Wes Grimm. For three tattoo artists, he’s not just a name — he’s also a judge. Can these artists design a tattoo worthy of the name, and who will have just enough heart to win?

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: Gabi is a true triple-threat who isn’t afraid to crack a joke on these three blind dates. Which gentleman will tickle this leading lady’s funny bone the most?

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Tis’ the season for beautiful light displays, Christmas cookies and holiday cheer. Watch these inspiring stories from around the country to help get you in the holiday spirit.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Explore Albuquerque's electric allure! Uncover secrets of a haunted brothel, step into hidden speakeasies, savor the spicy kick of green chile and lose yourself in epic views. Join us as we journey into the heart of New Mexico!

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.desc: What’s the best way to experience Milwaukee? By boat! Greg gets a kayaking tour from the founder of Support Local MKE, Marleigh Petras, who shows him all the best spots to hit along the Menomonee River.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: In honor of Pittsburgh's love of handhelds, Chef Claudy Pierre and Chef Alex Brown get creative crafting their best sandwich-inspired dishes.

programme.title: What's On The Menu?
programme.desc: No need to pack your suitcase, because we're exploring some the world's best cuisines in Baltimore. From street cart tacos to traditional Neapolitan pizza, the Charmed City is a hot destination for international flavors.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Watch Rob howl like a wolf, chill out with African penguins and go horseback riding in this episode celebrating the natural world.

programme.title: Only In
programme.desc: Where can you find a cake decorating class dripping with creativity, an upcycling utopia and a timeless treasure hunt? The same place with a declassified presidential bunker and 1,000 mermaids saving our reefs.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: In 1990, an 18-year-old driving across Wisconsin to a job conference never arrives. After her van and later her body are discovered, the mystery surrounding Berit Beck’s death persists for more than two decades. What happened in that van?

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Witness extreme car chases captured on video, from fleeing via fire truck to off-roading into a corn field. Fortunately no one is seriously hurt – except, at times, the vehicles.

programme.title: Shift: The Ragbrai Documentary
programme.desc: A celebration of the oldest, largest, and longest recreational touring bicycle ride in the world. Three riders and a pair of community leaders reach new personal heights, changing their lives along the seven day ride across Iowa.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: In this game show, comedian Frank Nicotero hits the streets to ask people questions inspired by the wildest news stories for a chance at winning a cash prize. These real-life stories with unreal outcomes will make you say, “Wait, What Happened?"

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Embark on amazing adventures across America with host Kinga Philipps who takes locals out of their comfort zones to experience transformation in the great outdoors.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Completed Episodes
programme.desc: Indulge in the old-school classics that have reigned in the Midwest for decades. From Wisconsin cheese curds to Kansas City's burnt ends, enjoy these unique comfort foods that are as timeless as they are tasty.

programme.title: Flood of '93: 30 Years Later
programme.desc: (2023) KCCI is looking back at the Flood of '93. In our first look back, KCCI’s Stacey Horst gives us a day-by-day timeline of how this historic disaster played out.

programme.title: LIVE: Big College Kickoff
programme.desc: A weekly college football pregame show that focuses on Iowa's NCAA Division I teams, offering local perspectives, behind-the-scenes insights, and fan culture from Iowa’s Sports Leader.

programme.title: The Spark

programme.title: Plate It!

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: Each episode of this documentary series features incredible sports stories from iconic American cities. From gritty underdog victories to passionate unlikely match-ups, the series proves that sports are so much more than a pastime.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: One local single experiences some of the best their city has to offer on three blind dates. Our singles may spend three perfect days out on the town, but there can only be one love match. Who will be picked for a second date?

programme.title: West By Orphan Train
programme.desc: A gripping documentary uncovering real stories of children loaded on trains, sent west, and presented “for the picking.” From 1854 to 1929, over 6,000 children landed in Iowa communities. Discover their emotional journeys and impact on the Midwest.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: In Milwaukee, 19-year-old Sade Robinson has gone missing, and her car is found torched. A trail of evidence across the city shocks the community and leaves her family searching for justice.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: Lifestyle blogger Morgan is ready to find her special someone. Three Des Moines bachelors try to capture her heart one date at a time. Will it be by getting creative, using a good offense or will she roll into love on wheels?

programme.title: Bayou Strangler
programme.desc: A serial predator terrorizes Southeastern Louisiana, strangling men to death and disposing of their bodies like trash. This deranged killer gets away with murder for nearly a decade until a potential victim escapes his clutches and then leads police right to the killer's doorstep.
